page.title: 13CHESTERTON MANOR HOUSE
page.content: The original moated Manor house was built next to the church.Behind the church the sunken field was used for tournaments.When plague caused the village to move further up the valley the tournament ground became the village fish pond which can be seen clearly nowadays.The new manor was built on the opposite hill,and the remains can be visited,although there is little to be seen except the surrounding wall,foundations and the old stables which are now the Humblebee Cotages.A tree lined avenue led to the Lodge which is now a thriving farm of over 600 acres.A path led from the manor,over the fishponds to an arch designed by Inigo Jones,which still stands ,into the church.
